town: <br><span class="first-character">H</span>eirlende is located in the temperate seashore, where the vegetation is thick. Heirlende grew around a well-traveled crossroads. They harvest corn, and nearby is a region rich with softwood lumber.They are a <span class="tip dotted" title="The workers own the lands they work on collectively, and together benefit from its prosperity.">syndicalist</span> <span class="tip dotted" title="Governed by the wizards.">magocratic</span> <span class="tip dotted" title="An elected body of representatives wield the powers of government.">republic</span>. The nearest <span class="tip" title="This changes each time you click."><a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">landmark</a></span> is <span id="random">a large tree that is over 30 feet in diameter. This hulking monstrosity of nature has been cared for by locals and some revere it as a god.</span> A population of 2077, the denizens live a modest existence. An arrival of marching modrons is currently taking place.<br><h3>Government in Heirlende</h3>The people of Heirlende own the lands they work on collectively, and together benefit from its prosperity. Affairs are handled by <span class="tip" id="leader"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">The Devout Brothers</a></span>, the head of whom is Mr <span class="tip" id="cc375931-ebcf-4509-bacb-591164863b48"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Jaeck Burnside</a></span><br><h4>Economics</h4>Trade is reasonable in Heirlende, and people live a modest existence because of it; some taxes are applied to certain goods and services that are rendered in the city. Welfare is below average. Citizens are largely left to their own fate except in extreme cases. Healthcare is neglected, and education is an afterthought. Most citizens would have better luck from private benefactors or the church than relying on the government. <h4>Law and Order</h4>There is a policing presence in Heirlende, but it is more for outside intruders rather than the population inside. Citizens are expected to follow the laws, and those that do have nothing to fear from <span class="tip" id="ef21ee64-3784-4929-b41b-728ba1b33805"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">The Lawful Watchers</a></span>. Law in Heirlende is reform-based, and those that breach the laws can expect fines, penalties, or work-release programs to provide them with the best possible chance to not become a recidivist. Magic is reserved only for the ruling class of mages and those who manage to procure a license, which is an intentionally confusing affair of different forms that need signatures from the council of wizards that govern Heirlende.<br><a class="link-internal macro-linkappend" tabindex="0"><h3>Racial Demographics</h3></a><span class="macro-linkappend-insert macro-linkappend-in"></span><br><a class="link-internal macro-linkappend" tabindex="0"><h3>List of Factions</h3></a><span class="macro-linkappend-insert macro-linkappend-in"></span><br><a class="link-internal macro-linkappend" tabindex="0"><h3>List of NPCs</h3></a><span class="macro-linkappend-insert macro-linkappend-in"></span><br><a class="link-internal macro-linkappend" tabindex="0"><h3>List of Buildings</h3></a><span class="macro-linkappend-insert macro-linkappend-in"></span><br><a class="link-internal macro-linkappend" tabindex="0"><h3>List of Throwaway NPCs</h3></a><span class="macro-linkappend-insert macro-linkappend-in"></span><br><a class="link-internal macro-linkappend" tabindex="0"><h3>Professions in Heirlende</h3></a><span class="macro-linkappend-insert macro-linkappend-in"></span>

21cd46a3-7c8e-495d-88c6-5efe0a60dbef.name: The Town Square
21cd46a3-7c8e-495d-88c6-5efe0a60dbef.output: <h1>The Town Square</h1><br>You're in the town square. It's huge and hectic, and relatively tidy. It features a small well that several shabbily dressed folk are waiting in line for. As you pass through, you see <span class="tip" id="bad689c1-360f-4de6-a2fa-e5436f558185"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">a half-elf with a rather wild, unkempt beard</a></span> who is hastily walking past.<br>There's a <span class="tip" id="181627f5-be2f-47cc-a652-203a4ba7b034"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">white skinned quite diminutive halfling</a></span> who calls out to you, and says "You look lost. Do you know your way around the city? I can guide you, for just 5 Silver". <blockquote>He will lead the players down an alley where his compatriots will attempt to rob the players.</blockquote> There's also a noticeboard, which has various posters, requests, and announcements tacked to it.<br><br><br><br><span class="macro-live macro-live-block"><div id="poster"></div></span>

453c0c15-96db-4be7-bb5e-65f6a8c751a9.name: The Spring Way market
453c0c15-96db-4be7-bb5e-65f6a8c751a9.output: <h1>The Spring Way market</h1>You wander through the streets of Heirlende, and come across the market, which is located in a series of small buildings connected by covered awnings. It seems that the vendors are organised by nation of origin of the merchandise. The market is known for the interesting things you can find, and is a victim to the chaos that is so common in markets. Today the market is a little crowded, but the crowds have parted way for a noble who is passing through with an envoy looking for a specific item.<br><br><h3>Merchants</h3> <br>A <span class="tip" id="ee974dc8-a08d-4b6b-a766-687f7fc688a8"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">prime adult aged human</a></span> is selling knockoff enchanted items from a myriad of pockets in the vendor's clothes.<br><br>Off to the side, a <span class="tip" id="80dd381f-deb1-4ecc-a68a-c65ac7014fb1"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">bony male halfling</a></span> is beckoning "Hands for sale! Don't ask where they came from! Best price in all the lands!" from a handful of crates or chests the vendor has set up.<br><br>A <span class="tip" id="e8113eb1-8128-408e-a29f-441c2fb68341"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">bony halfling</a></span> is shouting "Gargoyles with breasts engraved on them! Even a dwarf would buy at this price!" from a permanent table with a tent set up around it.<br><br>Off to the side, a <span class="tip" id="2846455e-0cf2-42e4-82d2-a9cb2db07658"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">bony halfling</a></span> is selling traditional dwarven ale from a makeshift looking storeftont.<br><br><br><br>

655c971d-ca09-4dee-aaec-03b755ff06e3.name: The Jetty
655c971d-ca09-4dee-aaec-03b755ff06e3.output: <h1>The Jetty</h1><span class="first-character">Y</span>ou walk down to the docks, which are known best for it's large ornate lighthouse, an ancient statue of a humanoid figure with all details eroded by time. It holds the lighthouse's beacon aloft in it's hand. You notice a pair of sailors accidentally dropping one of their crates of cargo into the water. The docks are average sized, with room enough for a fair few ships, and is spotless, save for a couple splashes of sea water. It's currently reasonably busy, with a couple folks milling about, waiting for a ship to dock.<br><span class="macro-live macro-live-block"><div id="ships"> <div class="classTable"> <table> <tr> <th>Name</th> <th>Type</th> <th>Delete</th> </tr> <tr> <td> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">La Katerine</a> </td> <td> Nef </td> <td> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">x</a> </td> </tr> </table> </div> </div></span><br><a class="link-internal macro-linkreplace" tabindex="0"><h4>People Around</h4></a><span class="macro-linkreplace-insert macro-linkreplace-in"></span>

522bba3e-3061-4473-a4ea-41a0fcf1cd65.name: The Cheap Scribe
522bba3e-3061-4473-a4ea-41a0fcf1cd65.output: <h1>The Cheap Scribe</h1><br><span class="first-character">Y</span>ou make your way down Spring Way, and enter undefined wood shop with a white undefined roof and see that inside, the quite large building is somewhat messy. $building.clutter You notice one of the customers is trying to shoplift while the shopkeep is helping someone else. The store's shopkeep is currently filling several leather flasks with oil from a large barrel with a tap.<br><br><h3>Shopkeeper</h3><br>The shopkeep smiles and greets you as soon as you come through the door. He introduces himself as <span class="tip" id="173cb7c1-2821-4446-8b6d-e40cf45794f7"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Lazam Wiseacre</a></span>, the acting manager of the General Store, and lets you know that all fishing tackles are 20% off. Lazam can tell a story behind everything he sells.<br><br><br><a class="link-internal macro-linkappend" tabindex="0"><h4>Buy something</h4></a><span class="macro-linkappend-insert macro-linkappend-in"></span><br><a class="link-internal macro-linkreplace" tabindex="0"><h4>Customers</h4></a><span class="macro-linkreplace-insert macro-linkreplace-in"></span>

809659ca-28d3-49a2-b2a1-97fdf57c0b3c.name: Heirlende Prison
809659ca-28d3-49a2-b2a1-97fdf57c0b3c.output: <h1>Heirlende Prison</h1>Heirlende Prison is submerged in the middle of a lake - halfway to the bottom and was built for another purpose originally. It is known for a mass escape in the past, and consists of a series of corridors with very low ceilings. It is rumoured that hidden inside the dungeon is a secret tunnel to the outside.<br><h4>Cells</h4>The cells inside the dungeon are so dark it’s difficult to say what condition they are in, and prisoners are kept in cells that accommodate up to two prisoners. Prisoners of Heirlende Prison are treated like they don’t exist; occasionally they receive food. The jailer, <span class="tip" id="c0123214-ee46-495a-be7f-463c3442cf64"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Milo Swiftwhistle</a></span>, is a repentant thief, who made a living jail-breaking, only to release the worst serial killer in the land.<br><br><span class="click-and-remove-link"><a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Meet a prisoner</a></span><br><span class="macro-live macro-live-block"><div id="prisoners"></div></span><br><div id="BuildingRelationshipsTable"> <div class="classTable"> <h3>Relationships</h3> <table> <tr> <th>Name</th> <th>Race</th> <th>Occupation</th> <th>Relationship</th> </tr> <tr><td><span class="tip" id="c0123214-ee46-495a-be7f-463c3442cf64"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Milo Swiftwhistle</a></span></td> <td>Halfling</td> <td><span class="tip dotted" title="A person who has been convicted of a crime and has since served their sentence, or who has preemptively given up their life of crime.">Ex-criminal</span></td> <td><span class="tip dotted" title="Heirlende Prison is a workplace to Milo">Jailer</span></td></tr> </table> </div></div>

13fa78c6-5d47-4963-af29-384406b53f5d.name: The Glimmeric
13fa78c6-5d47-4963-af29-384406b53f5d.output: <h1>The Glimmeric</h1><span class="first-character">Y</span>ou make your way down Spring Way, and enter The Glimmeric undefined terra cotta house of ill-repute with undefined planked roof. Inside, the spacious terra cotta building is fastidious. You notice a lengthy, shrill scream.<br>When people talk about The Glimmeric, they say the girls are well compensated for their dirty deeds. Apparently, it specialises in being an all male brothel.<br>Rumours abound in whorehouses, and The Glimmeric is no different; apparently, the brothel has a secret backroom where all the really crazy stuff happens.<br><br><h3>Brothel Mistress</h3><br>The Mistress is showing a few of the local girls how to use a new toy, she appears to be a mean old madam. Once she notices you the elf turns your way, and walks over to where you are. She introduces herself as <span class="tip" id="efdf3fef-ed0f-4e93-befd-0464e0c1e9a6"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Ielenia Galanodel</a></span>, the Mistress of The Glimmeric, and asks what she can do for you.<br><br><span class="click-and-remove-link"><a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0"><h4>Meet one of the harlots</h4></a></span><span class="macro-live macro-live-block"><div id="harlot"></div></span><br><br><a class="link-internal macro-linkreplace" tabindex="0"><h4>Customers</h4></a><span class="macro-linkreplace-insert macro-linkreplace-in"></span>

leader.name: The Devout Brothers
leader.output: <h1>The Devout Brothers</h1><br><span class="first-character">T</span>he Devout Brothers is a priests college. It's new, and the miniscule faction has an excellent reputation, and is motivated by money. They are rumoured to be under investigation.<br><br><h3>Governance</h3>It's ruled by <span class="tip" id="cc375931-ebcf-4509-bacb-591164863b48"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Jaeck Burnside</a></span>, who was able to rise to power through nepotism. He is very competent, and his position is rapidly disintegrating due to internal power struggles. Bribes are treated as insults. <br><h3>Members</h3><br>Members of The Devout Brothers are identifiable by the amulet they wear. Membership requires some social status, and costs five hundred gold pieces, plus a tremendous task. The initiation into The Devout Brothers involves a secret ritual.<br><a class="link-internal macro-linkreplace" tabindex="0"><h4>Create Members</h4></a><span class="macro-linkreplace-insert macro-linkreplace-in"></span><br><div id="BuildingRelationshipsTable"> <div class="classTable"> <h3>Relationships</h3> <table> <tr> <th>Name</th> <th>Race</th> <th>Occupation</th> <th>Relationship</th> </tr> <tr><td><span class="tip" id="cc375931-ebcf-4509-bacb-591164863b48"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Jaeck Burnside</a></span></td> <td>Human</td> <td><span class="tip dotted" title="Has devoted their entire being to the will of their god, thus gaining magical powers.">Cleric</span></td> <td><span class="tip dotted" title="[object Object] is the leader of The Devout Brothers, and is very competent.">Head of Faction</span></td></tr> </table> </div></div><br><h3>Resources</h3>They have limitless resources. A significant number of magical weapons are jealously guarded, as are one or two contacts, one or two valuable trade goods, some blackmail material, and one or two favours. <br><h3>Politics</h3>The Devout Brothers have barely any allies; A handful of merchants are the only others they can rely on. <br><br>The Devout Brothers have a couple enemies; A guild of artisans are the enemies of The Devout Brothers.

c05f139a-0b02-4ed4-a945-08d6453f33ce.name: The Cutpurses of Heirlende
c05f139a-0b02-4ed4-a945-08d6453f33ce.output: <h1>The Cutpurses of Heirlende</h1><br><span class="first-character">T</span>he Cutpurses of Heirlende is a thieves guild. It's relatively new, and the slightly below average sized faction has an excellent reputation, and is motivated by money. They are for the current political regime.<br><br><h3>Governance</h3>It's ruled by <span class="tip" id="fd92d66c-5271-451e-bb7a-69bac5c4487d"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Mican Bigheart</a></span>, who was able to rise to power by completing an ordeal. He is usually competent, and his position is quite unstable. Bribes will usually be rejected. <br><h3>Members</h3><br>Members of The Cutpurses of Heirlende are identifiable by their rabble-rousing tendencies. Membership requires endorsement by the current leader, and costs a hundred gold pieces. The initiation into The Cutpurses of Heirlende involves a secret task.<br><a class="link-internal macro-linkreplace" tabindex="0"><h4>Create Members</h4></a><span class="macro-linkreplace-insert macro-linkreplace-in"></span><br><div id="BuildingRelationshipsTable"> <div class="classTable"> <h3>Relationships</h3> <table> <tr> <th>Name</th> <th>Race</th> <th>Occupation</th> <th>Relationship</th> </tr> <tr><td><span class="tip" id="fd92d66c-5271-451e-bb7a-69bac5c4487d"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Mican Bigheart</a></span></td> <td>Halfling</td> <td><span class="tip dotted" title="A sneaky person.">Rogue</span></td> <td><span class="tip dotted" title="[object Object] is the leader of The Cutpurses of Heirlende, and is usually competent.">Head of Faction</span></td></tr> </table> </div></div><br><h3>Resources</h3>They have limitless resources. A significant number of artifacts are in their proverbial warchest, as are a chest of gold, a fair few favours, one or two valuable magical trinkets, and a drawer of magic scrolls. <br><h3>Politics</h3>The Cutpurses of Heirlende have some strong allies; A veritable army of rangers and a veritable army of knights can be called on for aid. <br><br>The Cutpurses of Heirlende have a handful of rivals; A guild of priests and a guild of commoners are the only that wish The Cutpurses of Heirlende ill.

13f58f81-ce96-46e6-94b6-0cfedeba0993.name: The Barefoot Protectors
13f58f81-ce96-46e6-94b6-0cfedeba0993.output: <h1>The Barefoot Protectors</h1><br><span class="first-character">T</span>he Barefoot Protectors is a rangers guild. It's quite new, and the quite small faction has an excellent reputation, and is motivated by knowledge. They are rumoured to dabble in forbidden magics.<br><br><h3>Governance</h3>It's ruled by a committee of 7, who were promoted by being the most powerful in the group. They are reasonably competent, and their positions on the committee are stable due to the lack of infighting for the leadership roles. Their meetings are held every third day, and are are open to those that can find them. Bribes to the committee are uncommon, and frowned upon. <br><h3>Members</h3><br>Members of The Barefoot Protectors are identifiable by the lack of footwear. Membership requires referral by an existing member, and costs twenty gold pieces. The initiation into The Barefoot Protectors involves a simple form to be filled.<br><a class="link-internal macro-linkreplace" tabindex="0"><h4>Create Members</h4></a><span class="macro-linkreplace-insert macro-linkreplace-in"></span><br><div id="BuildingRelationshipsTable"> </div><br><h3>Resources</h3>They have limitless resources. A fair few contacts are in their proverbial warchest, as are a chest of gold, one or two valuable magical weapons, a handful of trade goods, and a drawer of blackmail material. <br><h3>Politics</h3>The Barefoot Protectors have few allies; A guild of artisans are the only others they can rely on. <br><br>The Barefoot Protectors have more enemies than one would expect; A guild of bandits are enemies of The Barefoot Protectors, as are a guild of bandits, and a guild of mercenaries.

ef21ee64-3784-4929-b41b-728ba1b33805.name: The Lawful Watchers
ef21ee64-3784-4929-b41b-728ba1b33805.output: <h1>The Lawful Watchers</h1><br><span class="first-character">T</span>he Lawful Watchers is a guards watch. It's extremely old, and the very large faction has an excellent reputation, and is motivated by money. They are highly involved in the local community.<br><h3>Policing</h3><br>Heirlende is policed by The Lawful Watchers, rather than a separate guard. The guard is underfunded, and their equipment is always in slight disrepair. Their officers are held accountable for their actions when public pressure fors for it, though The Lawful Watchers does not have the funding to perform training exercises.<br><br>One can recognise a member of The Lawful Watchers by the lime green and dark turquoise livery adorned with an image of a ghost.<br><h4>Law in Heirlende</h4><br>Law in Heirlende is reform-based, and those that breach the laws can expect fines, penalties, or work-release programs to provide them with the best possible chance to not become a recidivist.<br><h3>Governance</h3>It's ruled by <span class="tip" id="12fc84cc-f9e8-4365-8a14-0728ec35771d"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Elyjah Briar</a></span>, who was the strongest of the group. He is somewhat incompetent, and his position is quite unstable. Bribes will be met with laughter. <br><h3>Members</h3><br>Members of The Lawful Watchers are identifiable by the ring that members are given. Membership requires a display of bravery, and costs a hundred gold pieces. The initiation into The Lawful Watchers involves an oath to be taken.<br><a class="link-internal macro-linkreplace" tabindex="0"><h4>Create Members</h4></a><span class="macro-linkreplace-insert macro-linkreplace-in"></span><br><div id="BuildingRelationshipsTable"> <div class="classTable"> <h3>Relationships</h3> <table> <tr> <th>Name</th> <th>Race</th> <th>Occupation</th> <th>Relationship</th> </tr> <tr><td><span class="tip" id="12fc84cc-f9e8-4365-8a14-0728ec35771d"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Elyjah Briar</a></span></td> <td>Human</td> <td><span class="tip dotted" title="A common warrior.">Fighter</span></td> <td><span class="tip dotted" title="[object Object] is the leader of The Lawful Watchers, and is somewhat incompetent.">Head of Faction</span></td></tr> </table> </div></div><br><h3>Resources</h3>They have limitless resources. A chest of gold are jealously guarded, as are a room full of gems, a significant number of magical trinkets, and a drawer of magic scrolls. <br><h3>Politics</h3>The Lawful Watchers have a considerable number of allies; A veritable army of commoners will help if called upon, as will a veritable army of artisans, a veritable army of monks, and a veritable army of craftsmen. <br><br>The Lawful Watchers have a handful of rivals; A guild of assassins and a guild of assassins are the only that wish The Lawful Watchers ill.

(with a BMI of 20)">rather solidly built</span>, and has brown eyes and a scraggly beard, with dark tan skin.
